column1: #Text=So it would n't be an immediate cut ?
#Text=You know it 's not really a cut because student loans are student loans .
#Text=You ca n't escape a student loan even under bankruptcy .
#Text=So these loans are going to get paid back but the argument is is that student loans , government-guaranteed student loans are a direct cause of tuition being as high as it is .

#Text=( ( WSS ) ) Okay . I have a question here about entitlements : During the Tea Party Republican Party Debate on September 12 , 2011 , one of which you were not invited to , Wolf Blitzer [ the debate ’s moderator ] , he provided the following scenario to Ron Paul , this is what he said , he said :

#Text=" A healthy thirty-year-old young man has a good job , makes a good living , but decides , you know what ? I 'm not going to spend $ 200 or $ 300 a month for health insurance because I 'm healthy , I do n't need it .

#Text=( ( William S. Saturn ) ) Let 's shift to foreign affairs . On your website , you say  America simply cannot afford to be engaged in foreign policy programs that are not clearly protecting U.S. interests . " In the case of a humanitarian crisis as in Syria right now , does the U.S. ever have a moral obligation to intervene militarily even if it is not clearly in the U.S. interest ?

column1: #Text=Look , we end up supporting a new dictatorship that takes over from the old dictatorship .
#Text=The results are no better or even worse than the old .
#Text=So we intervene in the name of humanity , and the result is like I say , more times than not , a situation that is worse , not better .
